data.title: Dukes Win 13 Total Matches at NYCC Collegiate Invitational in Norfolk
data.meta_description: JMU won 13 total matches in the hidden-dual format NYCC Collegiate Invitational in Norfolk. Youssef Sadek led the way with four total victories.
data.text:
Box Score NORFOLK, Va. – James Madison saw solid results in their second fall tournament of the year, winning a combined 13 matches at the NYCC Collegiate Invitational on Sept. 22-24, hosted by Old Dominion University at both the Norfolk Yacht & Country Club and the Folkes-Stevens Tennis Center.

The event was played in a hidden-dual format, with three doubles matches and seven singles bouts each day for the Dukes.

JMU faced off with William & Mary on Friday, Old Dominion and Norfolk State on Saturday and finished with competitors from Virginia Tech, College of Charleston and Virginia Wesleyan on Sunday.

JMU's play was highlighted by a 2-1 showing from the doubles team of Julian Lozano and Youssef Sadek. Sadek led the Dukes with four total wins, also going 2-1 in singles. He was joined by Esteve Agusti and Harrison Lee, who also went 2-1 individually.

On Friday, JMU won two matches against the Tribe. Lozano and Sadek downed Bill Duo and Alexandre LeBlank, 6-3, while Sadek completed his strong day with a 6-4, 6-3 victory over Konstantinos Raptis.

Doubles play highlighted Saturday's matches, as the Dukes went 3-0 in doubles and added three singles triumphs. Lozano and Sadek took down ODU's Jakob Cadonau and Codie van Schalkywk, 6-4. The team of Agusti and Mahesh downed ODU's Yanis Moundir and Aryan Saleh, 6-3, while Lee and Edson Sanchez took a 6-3 decision from NSU's Deniz Okya and Jakub Solarski.

On the singles side, Agusti claimed a comeback win over ODU's Cadonau (4-6, 6-2, 6-3), Sanchez won a tight bout with NSU's Okya (7-6 (7), 6-4), and Lee fended off NSU's Solarski in three sets (6-2, 4-6, 7-5).

The weekend concluded with five more singles wins on Sunday, including two in three sets. Lozano pulled away from VT's Alberto Orso (6-3, 6-7 (4), 6-2), while Agusti came back to beat VT's Matt Harper (1-6, 6-3, 4-1, ret.).

Claiming straight-set triumphs were Sadek against Charleston's Mattia Bernardi (6-0, 3-0, ret.), Mario Pena over Charleston's Evan Pugh (6-4, 6-3) and Lee versus Virginia Wesleyan's Carlos Rullan (6-1, 6-2).

Friday, Sept. 22 – JMU vs. William & Mary – Norfolk Yacht & Country Club

Doubles

Julian Lozano/Youssef Sadek (JMU) def. Bill Duo/Alexandre LeBlanc (W&M), 6-3

Satchel Benn/Oliver Hague (W&M) def. Esteve Agusti/Aathreya Mahesh (JMU), 6-4

Sean Joseph/Konstantinos Raptis (W&M) def. Harrison Lee/Edson Sanchez (JMU), 6-3

Singles

Alexandre LeBlank (W&M) def. Julian Lozano (JMU), 7-6 (4), 6-4

Youssef Sadek (JMU) def. Konstantinos Raptis (W&M), 6-4, 6-3

Satchel Benn (W&M) def. Esteve Agusti (JMU), 4-6, 6-1, 6-4

Oliver Hague (W&M) def. Aathreya Mahesh (JMU), 6-1, 6-1

Sean Joseph (W&M) def. Edson Sanchez (JMU), 6-2, 7-6 (4)

Bill Duo (W&M) def. Harrison Lee (JMU), 6-4, 6-3

Esteve Agusti/Aathreya Mahesh (JMU) def. Yanis Moundir/Aryan Saleh (ODU), 6-3

Harrison Lee/Edson Sanchez (JMU) def. Deniz Okya/Jakub Solarski (NSU), 6-3

Singles

Yanis Moundir (ODU) def. Julian Lozano (JMU), 6-2, 6-2

Codie Van Schalkwyk (ODU) def. Youssef Sadek (JMU), 6-3, 7-5

Esteve Agusti (JMU) def. Jakob Cadonau (ODU), 4-6, 6-2, 6-3

Aryan Saleh (ODU) def. Aathreya Mahesh (JMU), 6-4, 0-6, 6-2

Edson Sanchez (JMU) def. Deniz Okya (NSU), 7-6 (7), 6-4

Harrison Lee (JMU) def. Jakub Solarski (NSU), 6-2, 4-6, 7-5

Fred McRae (NSU) def. Mario Pena (JMU), 7-6 (4), 6-2

Sunday, Sept. 24 – JMU vs. Virginia Tech/CofC/Virginia Wesleyan – Norfolk Yacht & Country Club

Doubles

Matt Harper/Alberto Orso (VT) def. Julian Lozano/Youssef Sadek (JMU), 6-2

Mattia Bernardi/Matias Gaedechens (CofC) def. Esteve Agusti/Aathreya Mahesh (JMU), 6-4

Evan Pugh/Juan Diego Rojas (CofC) def. Harrison Lee/Edson Sanchez (JMU), 6-3

Singles

Julian Lozano (JMU) def. Alberto Orso (VT), 6-3, 6-7 (4), 6-2

Esteve Agusti (JMU) def. Matt Harper (VT), 1-6, 6-3, 4-1, retired

Youssef Sadek (JMU) def. Mattia Bernardi (CofC), 6-0, 3-0, retired

Mattias Gaedechens (CofC) def. Aathreya Mahesh (JMU), 6-1, 6-2

Juan Diego Rojas (CofC) def. Edson Sanchez (JMU), 6-4, 6-2

Mario Pena (JMU) def. Evan Pugh (CofC), 6-4, 6-3

Harrison Lee (JMU) def. Carlos Rullan (VWU), 6-1, 6-2

UP NEXT

JMU returns to action Oct. 6-8 when it travels to Richmond for the River City Tennis Open.
